title: South Korea’s AI law is the first of its kind: It aims to push AI adoption by keeping misuse firmly in check
description: With its AI Basic Act now in force, South Korea has become the first country to enact a comprehensive national law for artificial intelligence. The aim is not to slow adoption, but to make AI deployment safer, more transparent and sustainable—before deepfakes and scams can provoke a public backlash.
content: The Go master and 18-time world champion of the centuries-old strategy game later retired, calling AI an “entity that cannot be defeated." The spectacle was a warning, with then-president Park Geun-hye declaring Korean society was “ironically lucky" ... [4078 chars]

title: The future of AI will be written in nuts and bolts
description: For private equity investors, the real question surrounding artificial intelligence isn’t whether it will transform industries. It’s how those transformations will translate into real returns.
content:

title: China Gives Nod To Import First Batch Of Nvidia's H200 AI Chips: Report
description: China has reportedly given the green light for the first batch of Nvidia Corporation's (NASDAQ: NVDA) H200 artificial intelligence chips to be imported into the country.
content:

title: An ‘extremely dangerous time’ calls for a strategic Budget, warns ex-RBI chief Raghuram Rajan
description: Budget 2026: Former RBI chief Raghuram Rajan has a vital message for the upcoming Union Budget: prioritise long-term economic stability and self-reliance. He urges for a robust growth trajectory that enhances India's international relationships. Rajan warns of the looming global threats while also recognizing the merits of artificial intelligence.

title: ASML Q4 bookings beat expectations as chipmakers order more to satisfy AI demand
description: ASML reported stronger-than-expected bookings on Wednesday as the world's largest supplier of computer chip equipment received more orders thanks to larger investments in artificial-intelligence chipmaking capacity.
content: Fourth-quarter bookings, the most watched metric in the industry, were 13.2 billion euros ($15.8 billion), compared with 5.4 billion euros in the previous quarter. That compared with analyst expectations of 6.32 billion euros according to researcher ... [854 chars]

title: ASML Surges Ahead with AI-Fueled Chip Equipment Orders
description: ASML, the leading supplier of chipmaking equipment, reported a significant increase in fourth-quarter bookings, driven by strong artificial intelligence demand. The company recorded €13.2 billion in orders, surpassing expectations. This surge reflects a more optimistic market outlook from customers investing in AI-related chip production.
content:
ASML, the world's largest supplier of computer chip equipment, reported stronger-than-expected bookings on Wednesday, driven by increased investments in artificial intelligence chipmaking capacity.

title: China gives green light to importing first batch of Nvidia's H200 AI chips
description: China has approved its first batch of Nvidia's H200 artificial intelligence chips for import, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters, marking a shift in position as China seeks to balance its AI needs against spurring domestic development.
content:
The first batch of approvals has been allocated primarily to three major Chinese internet companies, with other enterprises now joining a queue for subsequent approvals, one of the sources said.
